summary: A travel authorization notification for a DOJ trip related to the Epstein investigation, approved for travel to Santa Monica, CA in December 2019 for a witness interview. The document shows ongoing investigative activity after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Etravelsen
persons.context: Appears as the sender of the automated travel authorization email from the E2Solutions system.

events.title: Witness interview travel authorization
events.description: Travel authorization approved for DOJ personnel to travel to Santa Monica, CA for a witness interview related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Travel approval notification
events.description: Travel authorization 11164814 was approved and notification sent via email, indicating ongoing Epstein investigation activities.

keyFacts: The DOJ was conducting witness interviews in the Epstein investigation as late as December 2019, after Epstein's death in August 2019.
Travel authorization 11164814 was approved for travel to Santa Monica, CA from December 15-18, 2019 for witness interview purposes.
The document reference 'R20NYS13444 - Epstein Investigation' indicates an ongoing federal investigation with a specific case identifier.
The email shows the use of the E2Solutions travel management system within the DOJ network for investigative travel.
The travel was approved in April 2020 for travel that had already occurred in December 2019, suggesting retrospective authorization or documentation.
